prompt.p: Which protein has the most significant effect on buffering the pH?

modalFeedback.p: Option D (Haemoglobin) is Correct. There are three major buffer systems that are involved in maintaining a relatively constant pH in body fluids. They are:

Option A (Albumin) is Incorrect. Albumin can act as buffer, but not the main protein.
Option B (Myoglobin) is Incorrect. Myoglobin is not the main protein.
Option C (Globin) is Incorrect. Globin is not the main protein.
Option E (Ferritin) is Incorrect. Ferritin is not the main protein.
